page.title: 10Hunts Refuse Disposals Ltd
page.content: The site covers 100 acres. Before 1939 it was all farmland. Then it began to have gravel extracted in 1939. About 1966 a Refuse firm bought it. Then in 1978{Hunts Refuse Disposals Ltd}took it over. Eight or nine firms use the tip. The containers of rubbish are brought in to the tip. There is soil at the bottom, then two metres of rubbish; then more soil covers it and then more rubbish until it is 7 metres deep. They also dig trenches for the liquid waste, lime sludge, sewage, chemical waste and blood from abattoirs.{A pest controller}comes regularly and they spray the flies. They use a{compactor}with spiky wheels on caterpillars. They repair their own machines. Eventually they will landscape the area.
